WHen is the Top 100 going to get fixed? The Whole 0 peers 0 seeders on every single new torrent started like 2 weeks ago.

Leechers should be a resource to if you think about it...

Ideally leechers each have many different parts of the file and contribute with what they already have downloaded.

But leechers may cut their upload rate if it APPEARS to hurt their download. So theyll put inn like 100kb for upload. Wich kinda sucks...

A torrent program should take into account lazyness, technical superstition and plain old stupidity when making their setup interfaces.

The human factor is also why I think RARs are a bad idea. People are lazy, selfish and stupid (they'll delete those RARs the second they are done unpacking them, since for them they are just wasted HDD space = seeding fails). Fighting that is a futile battle. So might as well work with the flow, not against it.

While going to school I worked part time at a gas station were we had trash cans. The area would be littered since people were to lazy to walk a few meters. Moving the cans into their path = alot cleaner and less cleaning up to do. Yelling at them or putting up signs were pretty pointless. Same with torrents. You just have to make it easy for people. Plus no RAR = they forget/don't care that the file is there and keep seeding. Thats working WITH lazyness, instead of against it...
Great quality, good speed! Thanks for the upload. (about leechers: it can't be helped, some people think that UPLOAD could affect DOWNLOAD negatively, when the truth is the whole opposite)

I dont understand why you rip the movie this way and say its 720p when its clearly 1280x536 with huge black bars can someone explain to me the reason or the people just dont know how to rip a movie properly?
You really thought i ripped it? I am just an uploader, ass'ole. Group named AMiABLE did it, bitch with them, not with me. OMG.

1280x536 is the same wide screen ratio as the movie theater.  And those huge black bars can be cropped out by the media player you use.  But you're not seeing the whole shot whether it's cropped by converter software before hand or you're video player while you play it.  I personally prefer seeing the whole picture that the director intended us too see.  

Maybe you should get a little more computer literate yourself before you go givein people attitude.
yes its better to watch 1280x536 than crop it to 1280x720.
